const TBdAddr invalidBdAddress

Detailed Description

General Bluetooth functionality.

This includes initialization of the Bluetooth radio and stack, handling properties such as device name, scanning for other devices using inquiry or Bluetooth Low Energy scan and more.

Definition in file cb_bt_man.h.

cb_int32 cbBM_add128BitsServiceClass ( cb_uint8 *  uuid128  ) 

Add service class to inquiry response data.

Typically not used by the application.

Parameters:
uuid128 The UUID to add.
Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBM_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBM_addServiceClass ( cb_uint16  uuid16  ) 

Add service class to inquiry response data.

Typically not used by the application.

Parameters:

Returns:

cb_int32 cbBM_deviceDiscoveryLe ( cbBM_DeviceDiscoveryTypeLe  type,
cb_uint16  discoveryLength,
cbBM_ScanTypeLe  scanType,
cbBM_DeviceDiscoveryLeEventCallback  eventCallback,
cbBM_DeviceDiscoveryLeCompleteCallback  completeCallback 
)

Start an Bluetooth Low Energy device discovery.

The event callback is called for every device that is found during inquiry.

Parameters:
type Type of discovery.
discoveryLength Length of inquiry in seconds.
eventCallback Callback used to notify each found device
completeCallback Callback used to notify when the inquiry is completed.
Returns:
If the device discovery is successfully started cbBM_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBM_deviceDiscoveryLeCancel ( void   ) 

Cancel an ongoing device discovery.

Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBM_OK is returned.

void cbBM_init ( cbBM_InitParams *  pInitParameters,
cbBM_InitComplete  initCompleteCallback 
)

Initialize the Bluetooth Radio, the connectBlue Embedded Bluetooth Stack and the Bluetooth Manager.

The init complete callback is used to notify when the initialization is complete. During initialization default values are set for all properties. The application shall set desired values for the main Bluetooth properties such as local name after the initialization is complete. After init the device is non discoverable and non connectable.

Parameters:
pInitParameters Init parameters
initCompleteCallback Callback used to notify when the initialization is complete.
Returns:
None

cb_int32 cbBM_inquiry ( cbBM_InquiryType  type,
cb_uint32  inquiryLengthInMs,
cbBM_InquiryEventCallback  eventCallback,
cbBM_InquiryCompleteCallback  completeCallback 
)

Start an Bluetooth inquiry.

The event callback is called for every device that is found during inquiry.

Parameters:
type Type of inquiry.
inquiryLengthInMs Length of inquiry in ms
eventCallback Callback used to notify each found device
completeCallback Callback used to notify when the inquiry is completed
Returns:
If the inquiry is successfully started cbBM_OK is returned

cb_int32 cbBM_inquiryCancel ( void   ) 

Cancel an ongoing inquiry.

Returns:
If the operation is successful cbBM_OK is returned.

cb_boolean cbBM_isServiceClassRegistered ( cb_uint16  uuid16  ) 

Check if service class is already registered.

Parameters:
uuid16 The UUID to check
Returns:
TRUE If the ServiceClass is registered, FALSE otherwise.

cb_int32 cbBM_remoteName ( TBdAddr *  pAddress,
cb_uint16  clockOffset,
cb_uint16  pageTimeout,
cbBM_RemoteNameCallback  remoteNameCallb 
)

Perform a remote name request for Bluetooth Classic.

Parameters:
pAddress Pointer to address of remote device.
clockOffset Clock offset. Can be found in inquiry response.
pageTimeout Page timeout in ms (Length of connection attempt).
remoteNameCallb Callback used to notify the the completion of the name request.
Returns:
If the operation is successfully initiated cbBM_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBM_remoteNameLe ( TBdAddr *  pAddress,
cbBM_RemoteNameCallback  remoteNameCallback 
)

Perform a remote name request for Bluetooth Low Energy.

Parameters:
pAddress Pointer to address of remote device.
createConnectionTmo Length of connection attempt in milliseconds.
remoteNameCallb Callback used to notify the the completion of the name request.
Returns:
If the operation is successfully initiated cbBM_OK is returned.

cb_uint32 cbBM_setAdvChannelmap ( cb_uint32  newValue  ) 

cb_uint32 cbBM_setAdvertisingIntervalMax ( cb_uint32  newValue  ) 

cb_uint32 cbBM_setAdvertisingIntervalMin ( cb_uint32  newValue  ) 

cb_int32 cbBM_setAfhChannelMap ( TChannelMap  channelMap,
cbBM_ChannelMapCallb  channelMapCallback 
)

Set default channel map for Bluetooth Classic.

Used to exclude channels from usage. Request an update of which channels shall be used by adaptive frequency hopping. typically this is not needed since the Bluetooth is very good at select which channels to use.

Parameters:
channelMap Channel map. Note that at least 20 channels must be enabled.
channelMapCallback Callback used to notify if the channel map is accepted by the radio.
Returns:
If the operation is successfully initiated cbBM_OK is returned.

cb_int32 cbBM_setAutoConnectionParams ( cb_uint32  createConnectionTimeout,
cb_uint16  connIntervalMin,
cb_uint16  connIntervalMax,
cb_uint16  connLatency,
cb_uint16  linklossTmo 
)

Set default Bluetooth Low Energy connection parameters.

Note that setting the connection parameters does not change the parameters on active connections.

Parameters:
createConnectionTimeout Default timeout connection for connection attempts
connIntervalMin Default connection min interval
connIntervalMax Default connection max interval
connLatency Default connection latency
linklossTmo Default link loss timeout
Returns:
cbBM_OK is returned on success.

void cbBM_setDefaultValuesLeParams ( void   ) 

This function sets all default parameters for LE.

This function needs to be called before the cbBM_init.

cb_int32 cbBM_setLocalName ( cb_char *  pName  ) 

Set local name This sets the Bluetooth Classic device name as well as the Bluetooth Low Energy device name.

Inquiry and advertising is updated.

Parameters:

Returns:
